meanings: respect (for), admiration (for), regard (for), (formal) esteem, (formal) reverence (for), respect (sb for sth), admire (sb for sth), (formal) esteem, (formal) revere, look up to

vlive.english: You saw the artists that you respected.

examples.korean: She enjoys the respect of her peers. 발음듣기 그녀는 동배들의 존경을 받고 있다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: She enjoys the respect of her peers. 발음

examples.korean: Her dedication to her work was admirable. 발음듣기 그녀의 일에 대한 헌신은 존경스러웠다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Her dedication to her work was admirable. 발음

examples.korean: She is held in high esteem by her colleagues. 발음듣기 그녀는 동료들의 많은 존경을 받고 있다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: She is held in high esteem by her colleagues. 발음

examples.korean: He professed his admiration for their work. 발음듣기 그는 그들의 작품을 존경한다고 공언했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He professed his admiration for their work. 발음

examples.korean: Children have no respect for their elders nowadays. 발음듣기 요즘에는 아이들이 어른들에 대한 존경심이 없다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Children have no respect for their elders nowadays. 발음
